refnamediv.refpurpose: copy into a file without destroying it

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Into copies its standard input into the specified outfile, but doesn't actually modify the file until it gets EOF. This is useful in a pipeline for putting stuff back in the "same place." The outfile is not overwritten if that would make it zero length, unless the -f option is given. That option also forces overwriting of the outfile even if it is not directly writable (as long as the directory is writable).

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para:
For efficiency reasons, the directory containing the outfile must be writable by the invoker.
The original outfile's owner is not preserved.
